data.title: Loved it!
data.text: Drive by this place frequently and it seems to always have customers, so we decided to give it a try for a quick lunch.  Food was very good and affordable price.  Walk up counter to order and delivered to your table when ready. Everything was hot and seasoned just right for our taste.  Look forward to returning the next time I want Thai food.

data.title: THE BEST Thai food in North Texas
data.text: I'm so addicted to this place.  Everything I eat here is delicious.  Spicy beef thai salad, Tom Kha soup, all curry dishes, MANGO STICKY RICE!! This is a small, mom and pop restaurant.  Authentic and delicious.  BYOB, so it is great for couples dinners but I also go here for lunch all the time.

data.title: wonderful
data.text: a must place to go eat at...wonderful place..great food..service is wonderful..great food for the price..we will be going back again and again....

data.title: A great meal with good friends.
data.text: Like previously stated, this is a simple restaurant with reasonable prices on Main Street in the older part of Frisco.  However, it has a pleasant atmosphere where we could visit with friends.  The food was delicious.  You order and pay at the counter.  The staff are very helpful explaining how the menu works.  I hope to go back on my next visit to Frisco.

data.title: Awesome food
data.text:
A friend introduced me to this little gem.
It is one of those great hole in the wall eateries. Everything I have tried there has been wonderful. Makes great leftovers also! 
My favorite is the yellow curry fried rice!

data.title: Awesome food, casual ambience.
data.text:
The ambience is basic but the food is delightful. The order taker was very helpful. 

The service is quick my appetizer and entree arrived together but the food made up for this simple faux pas in service.

I would highly recommend.

data.title: Great Thai food ....
data.text: Found this small restaurant on Frisco main street by coincidence. Food was very good and the service was quick. Very nice small town ambiance! Thoroughly enjoyed the Spicy Thai food. To top it off, they also served halal food.

data.title: Best prices, mom & pop place
data.text: We love coming to Simply Thai. We visit often within our children and the both live the place. Keep in mind this is a mom & pop shop, it's not fancy, space inside is limited (they have tables outside) but the food and the prices are totally worth it. The staff is friendly and stable, and the food is fresh, they can't keep their tables empty and that's a good thing. People are always coming and going with To Go orders.

data.title: Great food!!!
data.text: Great tasting curries, my kids devoured it very quickly! The finning area is very small, but the portions were huge do it made up for it 😉

data.title: To Go or Dine In
data.text: Either way you will enjoy your meal. The establishment is small but the staff put their all in the food they serve. I would have given 5 stars but I would recommend a really good cleaning of the restaurant.

data.title: Very competent and interestingly presented Thai cuisine
data.text: Ordering luncheon specials, appetizers and Thai tea was a pleasant surprise.  This is a really easy location, good parking nearby and quick, professional service.  Food was what we expected.  Thai Chicken was very well presented appertizer with a uniquely savory sauce.  I will be back.

data.title: Authentic Food!
data.text: Excellent food. Very fresh. The restaurant mostly does a take-out business. They have a few tables. Not much ambiance, although they do try.

data.title: Fresh and authentic
data.text:
It's one of those hidden gems -- right on Main street, you've probably driven by it hundreds of times!

The flavors are wonderful and portion sizes are spot on -- in fact, weekday lunch they surprise you with soup as an appetizer!

We haven't had a problem there yet in 20+ visits.  Sometimes it doesn't seem the cleanest place to eat, but I think it adds to the authenticity :-)

data.title: Average Thai food so a good choice if in the area and you are craving
data.text:
I've eaten here many times.  I like their crispy spring rolls, tom kha soup (perfect when you have a cold), and their pad kee mow.  Their pad thai is bland and their thai sweet and sour chicken I do not recommend or their potstickers - way too thick noodle and not good at all.  I haven't tried any of their currys yet.

Is it the best Thai I've ever had?  No.  Is it good?  Yes.  I wish there was a bit more flavor it is a bit bland, but overall a decent place if you're in the area to grab Thai food.  I would not drive out of my way to go here.

data.title: It's just ok
data.text: We order the fresh shrimp rolls and there were more lettuce than shrimp and we paid an extra $2 for it.  The Pad See Ew was good but the portion was really small. The Penang Curry was great but there was not too much chicken...it was more sauce than anything else.  So I don't think I would go back to this place.

data.title: Sloppy take-out, bland food :-(
data.text: Very dissatisfied with this place  Food was kind of bland (Pad Thai, Green Curry, Tom Kha), but worst of all was the terrible packaging for take out.  They put the Tom Kha and Green Curry in tall plastic containers, without any rubber band or tape for the lid, which both of course tipped over in the car and everything spilled out in the bag. Called them and they said the owner would call back, but that never happened.  Thai Green Village is immensely much better and they are always very careful and tape the lids on the containers so this won't happen.  Extremely disappointed and won't be back.  Not recommended at all.

data.title: Best Kept Secret of Frisco
data.text: Every dish, every time is delicious.  Small, so don't bring a big crowd, but definitely worth it!  Vegetarians and carnivores alike will find something to their liking available.

data.title: Sweet Suprise
data.text: In what appears to be just another little Asian dive, Simply Thai Bistro is a leap above. Dishes can be ordered 1-5 spicy heat rating for just the right amount of tongue searing. The sauces are exquisite, and all food cooked to order. The environment is authentic, with a fork/spoon utensil offering as opposed to the typical chopsticks, which are not really used in Thailand...a little known fact to most Americans who seem to expect sticks. We ordered appetizers Satay chicken, Edamame and Crab meat avocado spring rolls. Delicious! For entrees we ordered Pineapple curry, and Orange chicken. All first rate!

data.title: Amazing Thai food!
data.text: This is the place for Thai food in Frisco. Amazing  flavors! The staff is friendly and it has a wonderful quaint ambience. We will be frequent visitors to this restaurant.

data.title: Not a fan.
data.text:
Based on reviews here 4 of us went here for lunch on a Saturday. I would not return.
I ordered the Jungle Curry with tofu.
While the flavors were authentic, the portion was very small and the veggies, what few of them existed were not cooked. A small offering of rice came with the meal. I mean small. Rice is cheap! 
The Thai Iced tea was good, but for a total of $14.00 at a place where you order at a counter I was very disappointed in the value. 
We all agreed that we would not recommend.
